metadata.name: Potential Privilege Escalation Attempt Via .Exe.Local Technique
metadata.comment: Detects potential privilege escalation attempt via the creation of the "*.Exe.Local" folder inside the "System32" directory in order to sideload "comctl32.dll"

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('3') AND (startswith(lower(file.path), lower('c:\\windows\\system32\\logonui.exe.local')) OR startswith(lower(file.path), lower('c:\\windows\\system32\\werfault.exe.local')) OR startswith(lower(file.path), lower('c:\\windows\\system32\\consent.exe.local')) OR startswith(lower(file.path), lower('c:\\windows\\system32\\narrator.exe.local')) OR startswith(lower(file.path), lower('c:\\windows\\system32\\wermgr.exe.local'))) AND endswith(lower(file.path), lower('\\comctl32.dll')))

output.summary: Detects potential privilege escalation attempt via the creation of the "*.Exe.Local" folder inside the "System32" directory in order to sideload "comctl32.dll"
